intro: Erigeron salicinus, commonly known as the willowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a silvery underside, while its flowers bloom in clusters of white or pale yellow. It is known for its ability to thrive in wet environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
